messages.message: @Kerry @hannah We are working with a partner in france, AON is their customer. We have an AI Hub commercial multitenant deal on the table and they have asked for the Azure Open AI end point in Europe. It seems like that per JIRA it is "for development", but not sure if its available - is it possible to give us a steer on if/when this will be available

@Darragh Byrne for our MT deployment. It is hosted in the US, so regardless of the LLM API key data will be processed in the US. Is that acceptable?

Also, adding in @Kerry @shaunak, from what I understand, we don't have the ability to set the API key at the org level right just the tenant level?

First, the EPD initiative ticket for Azure Open AI is already marked as done on May 10th https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1275 As shared in the company all hands starting 24.16, AI Hub works with Azure Open AI. @Darragh Byrne from the process perspective, can you share what Jira ticket you're referring to here? (Maybe there's a duplicate ticket that we're not aware of; our goal has been really to enable the field to self-serve product progress through Jira, so this is something that we can improve).

Second, @hannah you are correct here -- as of now the API key is set at the tenant level, we don't have the ability to set at a org level.

In this case though, we won't be able to to use the MT AI Hub environment with the azure key then @Darragh Byrne as enabling it would mean that we'd need to enable it for all organizations. If the customer required data residency we could only support them with an EU ST environment.

Thank you @hannah @Kerry - just for clarity - ST commercial would be suitable, it wouldn’t need to be ST enterprise? Are there plans to make the Azure key available for MT commercial? There are a few customers in Europe we are getting this request from via partners.
